titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 3ra-84rb) - Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 15ra-17vb) - Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 17vb-23rb) - Mängädä sämay “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 26va-38vb) - Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 40rb-42rb) - Homily by St. Jacob of Serug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 62vb-66rb) - Lǝfafä ṣǝdq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (fols. 73vb-77vb) - Antiphons (Kǝśtätä ʾaryam, mäwaśǝʾt) performed for the funeral of different categories of Christians (fols. 79ra-80vb) - Burake zä-ʾanǝst “Benediction of women” (fols. 83ra-84rb)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Täklä Haymanot is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula on fol. 67rb. The scribe is different from that of Ms. AKM-003.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased from the supplication formulas and replaced with the names of Wäldä Mikaʾel, Täsfa Maryam and Wälätta Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 14vb, 38ra, 52vb), Wäldä Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fol. 61vb), Gäbrä Ḥǝywot (e.g., fol. 62ra), Kǝnfä Mikaʾel (e.g., fol. 61va). The first three names are also mentioned in Additiones 1 and 2. All the names have been added by a secondary hand, in vivid scarlet. According to Additio 3, the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʾAmätä Dǝngǝl. Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus might be identified with the second son of däğğazmač Säbagadis (1770-1831), Ḫagos (d. 1831). The identification is based on Additiones 1 and 2 in Ms. FBM-002. He also donated Ms. FBM-009.

dcomments.dcomment: The Patriarch of Alexandria (liqä ṗaṗṗasǝnä) ʾabba Marqos (in tenure ) and Metropolitan (ṗaṗṗasǝnä) ʾabba Matewos (in tenure ) and King Yoḥannǝs (r. ) are mentioned in the supplication formulas on fol. 40rb.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. The spine cover is missing. Fol. 38 is mutilated. Patched parchment hole: fol. 46. Holes repaired: fols. 6, 9, 29, 39, 48, 75, 83.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with light brown tooled leather (the spine cover is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the light brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: single circle, double line fillet, double sine wave with dots, criss cross).

bnothers.bnother: One pair of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. A row of holes is visible on the spine folds of the quires, close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(4/fols. 83r-86v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Ruled blank fols.: 1v, 2r-v, 81r-v, 82r-v, 85r-v, 86r-v.

rulings.ruling:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Ruled blank fols.: 1v, 2r-v, 81r-v, 82r-v, 85r-v, 86r-v.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of the texts; two initial lines of each section; initial lines of Psalms; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; abbreviations alternating with letters in black (e.g., fols. 9ra, 22rb, 23ra); words, e.g., wä-yǝwgǝr ʿǝṭanä (fol. 8rb), wä-yǝʿud (fol. 8rb), täwäkäf (fol. 8va), ʾaʾakkwǝto (fol. 10ra-b), wä-yǝblu (e.g., fols. 18va, 19rb, 20ra), burake (e.g., fols. 31vb, 33rb, 34rb); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ስቡ፤ / ስ፤ ው፤ ወ፤ ው፤ ለ፤ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለአለም፡ (fols. 6vb, 7ra) ይ፤ / ይባ፤ for ይባርክዎ፡ (fols. 6vb, 7ra) ለእ፤ for ለእግዚአብሔር (fols. 6vb, 7ra) ዝዕ፤ ዕ፤ ይ፤ በ፤ ተ፤ for ዝዕጣን፡ ይእርግ፡ በእንተ፡ (fols. 7va-vb, 8ra) ን፤ እ፤ ወ፤ በ፤ for ንስዕለከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ወናስተበቁዓከ፡ በእንተ፡ (fols. 8vb, 9ra, 9vb) ይ፤ ወ፤ ስ፤ ለእ፤ for ይትአኰት፡ ወይሴባሕ፡ ስሙ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ (fol. 10rb) የ፤ ወ፤ እ፤ ወ፤ ስ፤ እ፤ for የአኵቱከ፡ ወይሴብሑከ፡ እኵት፡ ወስቡሕ፡ ስምከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ (fols. 10rb, 10va-vb) ፍ፤ ለ፤ በ፤ / ፍ፤ ረ፤ ለ፤ በ፤ / ፍ፤ ረ፤ ለ፤ በ፤ በ፤ for ፍቱሐ ረስዮ ለዝንቱ በድን በአፈ (fols. 22ra, 22va-vb, 23ra-rb) አ፤ ይ፤ እ፤ for አሜን፡ ይባርክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ (fol. 26rb) ይ፡ ካ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., fols. 27r, 29va, 31rb) ይ፡ ዲ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 27r, 27vb, 29va) ይ፡ ሕ for ይበል፡ (fol. 29vb) አ for አሜን (fols. 28rb, 33rb) ቡ፡ ኩ፡ for ቡሩካነ፡ ኩኑ፡ (fol. 28rb) ይእ፡ ወዘ፡ ወለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 29vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fols. 30ra, 32rb) ቅዱስ፡ ቅ፤ ቅ፤ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (fol. 31ra) ሃ፤ ሉ፤ for ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ (fol. 31ra) ስረ፤ ሎ፤ ለገ፤ እ፤ for ስረይ፡ ሎቱ፡ ለገብርከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ (fols. 69vb, 70ra-rb, 70va-vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” I-1) Ṣälotä ʾǝṭan “Ritual of the Incense” (fols. 3ra-10vb) I-2) Admonition to be read over all the dead (fols. 11ra-14vb) I-3) Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 15ra-17vb) I-4) Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 17vb-23rb) I-5) Laʿlä kwǝllomu mǝwwǝtan, Reading over all the dead (fols. 23va-26va); I-6) Mängädä sämay “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 26va-38vb) I-7) Prayer of penitence that God gave to Peter (fols. 38vb-39vb) I-8) Anonymous homily on burial (fols. 39vb-40rb) I-9) Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 40rb-42rb) I-10) Burial ritual for: metropolitans (fols. 42rb-43ra); qomosat (fols. 43ra-44rb); priests (fols. 44rb-45va); deacons (fols. 45va-46vb); monks (fols. 46vb-48rb); young fathers (fols. 48rb-49vb); children (fols. 49vb-51ra); nuns (fols. 51ra-51vb); old women (fols. 51vb-52vb); little girls (fols. 52vb-53vb); I-11) Readings: on the day when the person died (fols. 53vb-55ra); on the third day (fols. 55rb-56ra); on the seventh day (fols. 56ra-56vb); on the twelfth day (fols. 56vb-57vb); on the thirtieth day (fols. 57vb-58vb); on the fortieth, sixtieth and eightieth days, and on the sixth month (fols. 58vb-62vb) I-12) Homily of St. Jacob of Sarug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 62vb-66rb) I-13) The story of the wealthy man who did not fear God (fols. 66rb-69ra) I-14) Ṣälotä nǝssǝḥa “Prayer of Penitence” (fols. 69ra-73vb) I-15) Lǝfafä ṣǝdǝq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (fols. 73vb-77vb) I-16) Ṣälotä burake zä-ʾabunä Samuʾel “Prayer of Benediction by ʾabunä Samuʾel” (fols. 77vb-79ra) I-17) Short hymn and supplication (Kǝśtätä ʾaryam with Musical notation), performed for the funeral of different categories of Christians (fols. 79ra-80vb) I-18) Burake zä-ʾanǝst “Benediction of the woman” (fols. 83ra-84rb) - Antiphons (Kǝśtätä ʾaryam, mäwaśǝʾt) contain interlineal musical signs.

additional.tran: Fol. 10vb: This book is of Wäldä Mikaˀel, his father is Täsfa Maryam and the name of his mother is Wälätta Mikaˀel.
additional.det: The note is written in vivid scarlet, in the same hand as Additio 2 and the names in the supplication formulas.

additional.tran: Fol. 84rb: [This] book is of St. Michael ˂…˃, which Wäldä Mikaˀel donated. His father is Täsfa Maryam [and his … is] ˁAmätä Mikaˀel.
additional.det: The note is written in vivid scarlet, in the same hand as Additio 1 and the names in the supplication formulas.

additional.tran: Fol. 84va: This book is of ˀAddigrat Mädḫani ˁAläm which Dagəmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qəddus donated and his wife is ˁAmätä Dəngəl, so that it might be for them a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven.
additional.det: The note is written in vivid scarlet, but in a finer hand, different from that of Additiones 1-2. It states that the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus whose wife is ʾAmätä Dǝngǝl. The note states that the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his wife ʾAmätä Dǝngǝl. The note is written in the same hand as the donation note in Ms. AMM-001 (s. Additio 2) and, most probably, the donation note in Mss. AMM-005, AMM-006.

extras.extra: - The title of the work, ግንዘት, is written in blue pen: fol. 1r. - Tämälläs-sign indicating the place where the omission, written in the margin, belong: fol. 58rb. - Corrections written interlineally: fols. 10rb, 10vb, 26ra, 38va, 71rb, 76va, 79ra. - Space for rubricated names left unfilled in the supplication formulas: fols. 14ra, 64v. - A note, probably the original ownership or donation note, has been erased from fol. 84rb. - A note, probably concerning donation, has been blotted out from fol. 84va. - Pen trial: fol. 10r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margin encircled with broken lines, referring to the content: fols. 11r, 13r, 23v, 25v, 27v, 29r, 39r, 39v, 40r, 42r, 53v, 55r, 56r-v, 57v, 58v, 59r, 60r, 62v, 64v, 67r, 69r, 70v.
